docs.summary: ToggleSwitches are used for a single binary choice.

srcDocs.summary: ToggleSwitches are used for a single binary choice.

docs.summary: Sets or gets whether a toggleSwitch is checked.
description: Setting the `checked` property to `true` places a check in
the toggleSwitch. Setting it to `false` removes the check from the toggleSwitch.
Getting the `checked` property returns
whether the toggleSwitch is checked or unchecked.

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets whether a toggleSwitch is checked.
description: Setting the `checked` property to `true` places a check in
the toggleSwitch. Setting it to `false` removes the check from the toggleSwitch.
Getting the `checked` property returns
whether the toggleSwitch is checked or unchecked.

docs.summary: Determines if a toggleSwitch is required to be checked.
description: If `required` is `true`, the toggleSwitch is only valid if it is
[checked](#checked).
If `required` is `false`, the toggleSwitch will always be valid.
You can also set a toggleSwitch to be required
by using the element's Settings pane in the Editor.

srcDocs.summary: Determines if a toggleSwitch is required to be checked.
description: If `required` is `true`, the toggleSwitch is only valid if it is
[checked](#checked).
If `required` is `false`, the toggleSwitch will always be valid.
You can also set a toggleSwitch to be required
by using the element's Settings pane in the Editor.

docs.summary: Sets or gets a toggleSwitch's value.
description: The `value` property is not related to whether the toggleSwitch is checked or
not. To determine the checked status of a toggleSwitch, use the [`checked`](#checked)
property.
The `value` property is used for storing a value that is associated with
the toggleSwitch.
It is not considered when evaluating the toggleSwitch's validity
and it does not trigger an `onChange` event when the value is modified.
Even if a toggleSwitch is connected to a dataset, its `value` property
is not related to the value of the collection field it is connected to.
The field's value is determined by the toggleSwitch's [`checked`](#checked) property.

The `value` property is used for storing a value that is associated with
the toggleSwitch.
It is not considered when evaluating the toggleSwitch's validity

Even if a toggleSwitch is connected to a dataset, its `value` property
is not related to the value of the collection field it is connected to.
The field's value is determined by the toggleSwitch's [`checked`](#checked) property.
